body: @vinothchandar @n3nash : Ready for review
@n3nash JIRA please? and can you capture that hive-on-spark is broken in the commit message for traceability?
I've captured it already in the commit message. I've updated this JIRA to reflect this : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-151.

Does this fix the issue with NOTICE files self updating on build? the one we hit before and disabled the plugin?

@vinothchandar : Yes, we had earlier disabled the notice plugin as it was noisy.  I ran "mvn notice:generate" manually to update NOTICE files.  Subsequent PRs will not see any difference in NOTICE files.
@garyli1019 just checking in to see if you need any help with this ?
Added a comment on HUDI-198, linking to PR
All, please provide feedback
@n3nash sorry for being late. Please review the latest commit

> I was getting some java import error involving Jackson which was resolved after I removed https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.uber.hoodie/hoodie-presto-bundle/0.4.7 from `plugins/hive-hadoop2/`.
> 
> I'm not sure if this resolves the entire import issue but I think it's a good idea for future debugging to happen with this change made, so future contributors no longer have to worry about typos.

Oops. My bad. Sorry for the trouble. Thanks for catching this @luke-zhu .
@n3nash any doc updates that need to done around this?  providing guidance on when to use this.. Merging this though. LGTM

> @v3nkatesh can you please create a JIRA as well and link this PR there..

@vinothchandar done.
left 2 comments, rest looks good to me

yeah, may be when we list all the files to be cleaned and then shuffle them to optimize performance of clean(), at that time the kryo serialization is trying to serde the filestatus objects and is failing ? @vinothchandar
Sure @vinothchandar Sorry for late reply. I am using emr-5.16.0 version which has Spark 2.3.1,Hive 2.3.3 and Hadoop 2.8.4 versions.

@vinothchandar : For certain jars, maven-notice-plugin was not able to find licenses. We have a license override file : release/config/license-mappings.xml to configure licenses for such jars.  

I will go ahead and merge this change. When I build release candidate, I will also run maven-notice plugin so that the jars have latest and correct notices.
look fine, can you fix the test failures and then we can merge this ?
@n3nash seems like test failures are caused by some sort of timeout. The rebuild was passed.
@vinothchandar @bvaradar The Travis is green now. Please review this PR if you have time. Thanks.
Thats great to know. thanks!
@vinothchandar I think I can collect all the problems I've found recently, then collect them together and see how to solve them. After collected, I will send you by slack.
@vinothchandar @bvaradar could you guys take a look or share your concerns on the jira please ?

@cdmikechen awesome.. Can we just repurpose https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-159 for this? I already did one pass a month or so ago.. 
Let's use JIRA anyway to coordinate further..

#796 seems to confirm it works with Hive 2.3.3 atleast.. So we need to take a holistic view and go from there.. Also checkout #809  which skips the HiveServer2 and talks to metastore directly.. Love to hear your views on this one

+1 for bug #3 in this report/HUDI-5.
AWS EMR/S3, Spark 2.4.0, hoodie release 0.4.7
hi @eisig , did you get a chance to look into this?
@imperio-wxm Are you using hoodie-spark-bundle to execute this job ?

@n3nash  

Hi, i didn't using hoodie-spark-bundle, i use my own spark2-shell to sumbit job on yarn.

And I try to copy `hoodie-hadoop-mr-0.4.7.jar`,`hoodie-common-0.4.7.jar` to $HIVE_HOME/lib, it works.
However I should restart whole hive cluster.
Sorry. Have not had the chance to look at this closely :(. Will circle back tmrw.
Gotcha, glad to hear it works fine. It looks like these jars didn't get picked up in the classpath until you restarted..
@imperio-wxm if I'm reading correctly, the hudi sync was able to successfully register the table but the partitions are incorrect ?

@zhangxinjian123 is this error in the second batch ingestion for structured streaming ? looks like the stream is getting closed..Can you provide :
1) the full stack trace
2) details on how you are running the job
3) hoodie version you are using
I used version gudi0.45. I upgraded spark to version 2.4.3 and wrote files using foreachBatch.
Why the latest version does not have the HoodieCompactionOperation file
@zhangxinjian123 are you running with num_cores > 1 . If so, suggest upgrading to 0.4.6 or later. This exception reminds me of that fix

>The hive partition should be in the form of key=value and hudi missing part_date field name.
This is a convention and not necessary per se for external tables.. 

Can you paste the logs you get for the Hive sync portion? In general, we expect `	.option(DataSourceWriteOptions.PARTITIONPATH_FIELD_OPT_KEY(), "part_date")` to have values of the form `yyyy/mm/dd` .. Do you have them as `yyyy-mm-dd` ?
@vinothchandar +1, that's exactly the problem here. Please upgrade to 0.4.6+

Few things I did to improve performance:
- changed max parquet size from 256MB to 128MB cuts the shuffle read size to half, which improve the performance without increasing the executor memory
- increase the single executor memory improve the performance as well
- avoid merging too many historical data
I am not able to get heapdump at this moment due to the cluster access issue, but I will try to print GC info to get some insight.

@vinothchandar @n3nash : Ready for review

Document Updates: 
https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/pull/831

Migration Guide:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/HUDI/Migration+Guide+From+com.uber.hoodie+to+org.apache.hudi
@shinray could you give master branch a shot if you have a reproducible case? #700 should be fixing this?
@garyli1019 thanks for the update!

>>org.scala-lang dependency and copied these scala codes 

Not sure if this was intended.. Does excluding the `scala-lang` from the bundle also solve this issue? 

#751 is precisely the start of that effort.. I really need a hand with that :) . Interested in helping out?  there is a bunch of low hanging fruit

@n3nash  

I didn't know why `spark2-submit --jars basePath/hoodie-hadoop-mr-0.4.7.jar` not works.

For example, the DataFrame I started writing saved to the path is three fields, the second two fields are normal, the third writing is four fields and the error is reported

The error information is as follows
```
Caused by: com.uber.hoodie.exception.HoodieException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 10
	at com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.BoundedInMemoryExecutor.execute(BoundedInMemoryExecutor.java:148)
	at com.uber.hoodie.table.HoodieCopyOnWriteTable.handleUpdateInternal(HoodieCopyOnWriteTable.java:206)
	... 33 more
Caused by: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 10
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:122)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:192)
	at com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.BoundedInMemoryExecutor.execute(BoundedInMemoryExecutor.java:146)
```

My code is as follows:
 dataList.writeStream.foreachBatch(

      (batchDF: Dataset[mutable.Map[String, String]], batchId: Long) =>

        if (!batchDF.isEmpty) {

          val cols: Array[String] = batchDF.take(1).flatMap(_.keys)
          val rddRow: RDD[Row] = batchDF.rdd.filter(_.nonEmpty).map { m: mutable.Map[String, String] =>
            val seq = m.values.toSeq
            Row.fromSeq(seq)
          }

          val fields: Array[StructField] = cols.map(fieldName => StructField(fieldName, StringType, nullable = true))
          val schemad: StructType = StructType(fields)
          val sparkSql: DataFrame = spark.createDataFrame(rddRow, schemad)

          val writer = sparkSql
            .write
            .format("com.uber.hoodie")
            .option("hoodie.insert.shuffle.parallelism", "2")
            .option("hoodie.upsert.shuffle.parallelism", "2")
            .option(DataSourceWriteOptions.STORAGE_TYPE_OPT_KEY, tableType)
            .option(DataSourceWriteOptions.OPERATION_OPT_KEY,
              DataSourceWriteOptions.INSERT_OPERATION_OPT_VAL)
            .option(DataSourceWriteOptions.RECORDKEY_FIELD_OPT_KEY,
              "_row_key")
            .option(DataSourceWriteOptions.PARTITIONPATH_FIELD_OPT_KEY,
              "partition")
            .option(DataSourceWriteOptions.PRECOMBINE_FIELD_OPT_KEY,
              "timestamp")
            .option(HoodieWriteConfig.TABLE_NAME, tableName)
            .option(DataSourceWriteOptions.KEYGENERATOR_CLASS_OPT_KEY, if (nonPartitionedTable) {
              classOf[NonpartitionedKeyGenerator].getCanonicalName
            }
            else {
              classOf[SimpleKeyGenerator].getCanonicalName
            })
            .mode(SaveMode.Append)
          writer.save(tablePath)


        }


    ).start()
      .awaitTermination()
cc @vinothchandar @bvaradar
Hi @vinothchandar please add pratyaksh13@gmail.com to slack group. I have already subscribed to the mailing list.
@zhangxinjian123 is it possible to provide a csv file or json file from which we can recreate `batchDF` and run locally? It seems like some input error that Hudi is not properly reporting..
@jackwang2 biggest issue here is that we could not reproduce the error ourselves.. are you able to provide some reproducible case? is it easy to repro?
Hi @vinothchandar  , could you add me to the slack group? My email is panxscu@163.com

first json:
```
{"database":"zhang","table":"hao","type":"insert","ts":1555984612,"xid":90202,"commit":true,"data":{"id":7,"Name":"zhang"}}
```
I get 7 and Zhang as values by parsing JSON to get ID and name as schemas, respectively. This is writable

second json:
```
{"database":"zhang","table":"haow","type":"insert","ts":1555984612,"xid":90202,"commit":true,"data":{"id":6,"Name":"zhang","Age":13,"code":19}}
```

```
57947 [pool-17-thread-2] ERROR com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.BoundedInMemoryExecutor  - error consuming records
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 10
	at org.apache.avro.generic.GenericData$Record.get(GenericData.java:212)
	at org.apache.avro.generic.GenericData.getField(GenericData.java:697)
	at org.apache.parquet.avro.AvroWriteSupport.writeRecordFields(AvroWriteSupport.java:188)
	at org.apache.parquet.avro.AvroWriteSupport.write(AvroWriteSupport.java:165)
	at org.apache.parquet.hadoop.InternalParquetRecordWriter.write(InternalParquetRecordWriter.java:128)
	at org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetWriter.write(ParquetWriter.java:299)
	at com.uber.hoodie.io.storage.HoodieParquetWriter.writeAvro(HoodieParquetWriter.java:103)
	at com.uber.hoodie.io.HoodieMergeHandle.write(HoodieMergeHandle.java:292)
	at com.uber.hoodie.table.HoodieCopyOnWriteTable$UpdateHandler.consumeOneRecord(HoodieCopyOnWriteTable.java:452)
	at com.uber.hoodie.table.HoodieCopyOnWriteTable$UpdateHandler.consumeOneRecord(HoodieCopyOnWriteTable.java:442)
	at com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.BoundedInMemoryQueueConsumer.consume(BoundedInMemoryQueueConsumer.java:38)
	at com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.BoundedInMemoryExecutor.lambda$null$2(BoundedInMemoryExecutor.java:126)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
57979 [pool-17-thread-1] ERROR com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.BoundedInMemoryExecutor  - error producing records
com.uber.hoodie.exception.HoodieException: operation has failed
	at com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.BoundedInMemoryQueue.throwExceptionIfFailed(BoundedInMemoryQueue.java:234)
	at com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.BoundedInMemoryQueue.insertRecord(BoundedInMemoryQueue.java:171)
	at com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.IteratorBasedQueueProducer.produce(IteratorBasedQueueProducer.java:45)
	at com.uber.hoodie.common.util.queue.BoundedInMemoryExecutor.lambda$null$0(BoundedInMemoryExecutor.java:96)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
```

At first I wrote correctly, but this error occurs when there are more new fields than the first one.

@vinothchandar  Thanks so much for your help.  I was specifying the parallelism in two areas which in-turn was taking the parallelism with small amount which lead to this slow performance. Now, its fixed and working efficiently.

Hi ,
Just try changing the value of WRITE_OLD_LIST_STRUCTURE_DEFAULT parameter from true to false in AvroWriteSupport class.
static final boolean WRITE_OLD_LIST_STRUCTURE_DEFAULT = false; 
It will allow array with null values.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/pull/806 tries to fix this.. But has been inactive for a while.. Are you able to try it out?  and if it works may be send a PR :) ?

@zhangxinjian123 this stack trace is clearer. You schema should also have the new fields and also follow general rules of avro backwards compatibility.. for eg: https://docs.confluent.io/current/schema-registry/avro.html
@anchalkataria interesting.. there also seems to be a flag to flip it? https://github.com/apache/parquet-mr/blob/master/parquet-avro/src/main/java/org/apache/parquet/avro/AvroWriteSupport.java#L60

>>When I run the job for the first time, no partition is added to generate the file.

are you seeing that the commit was successful and hive sync was successful and there were no partitions added in Hive? if so, thats not normal behavior.. Please clarify ..
@leesf good catch. Please close the JIRA once PR is merged

@hustnn seen few other issues reported with JDK11. But not a hang.. 

adding @bhasudha , who owns the presto component

Sure i will try the fix and also could you please let me know how i can change the partition value in s3 path while inserting/updating data through deltastreamer tool.
Currently the path gets created on s3 is like this `s3://<basepath>/<partition-value>/files.parquet`
`I want the path to be s3://<basepath>/partition-field=<partition-value>/files.parquet`
@vinothchandar Do you have the link for those issues? Thanks.

> Is it possible to use Hudi for Presto running on JDK 11 ?
> 
> Can give some advise on how to make it work ? What should I start with?

@hustnn Were you able to confirm same Presto query works in other JDK versions ?

@bhasudha 

Yes, it can run on jdk 8. It only stack at coordinator running on 11, if I change jvm version of coordinator to 8 and keep 11 for worker, it still can run.

@bhasudha 

 I can help to look at the issue.  Do you have some ideas on the possible reasons?

@vinothchandar @bhasudha 

I found the root cause.

@vinothchandar @bhasudha 

Seems the behavior of `ReflectionUtils.getTopLevelClassesInClasspath` has changed from 8 to 11

@hustnn That report was on slack. Unable to track it down now.. But dont think it was related to this.. 
@bhasudha if we can reproduce this on the presto docker you are building, that'd be great.

@tooptoop4 we can definitely whitelist company email domains as such.. opening up to any gmail/hotmail users means, the bots can also get it very quickly? :)
are you able to reproduce this on the docker setup?  that'd be awesome for us to take a look.
@bhasudha can you take a look from presto perspectie?
cc @vinothchandar and @bvaradar
Hi @vinothchandar - please add sudipcha@yahoo.com to the slack group.

@bhasudha @vinothchandar 

I am using open jdk 11.0.2 (build 11.0.2+9) on Linux.  FYI if you want to reproduce.

I got this issue when I use same adhoc 1 or 2 terminal to run the steps instead of exiting the current terminal and use one after each main steps per instruction.

May be some environmental variables override issue but not sure.
Please try to execute all the steps in single adhoc 1 or 2 terminal without exiting to reproduce the issue.
@n3nash This PR has conflicts files now. Would you please rebase it? thanks.
@hustnn Let me try to reproduce this. Will update soon.
@bhasudha  Thanks.
@taherk77 you may need to rebase against the renamed packaging :)
@yanghua thanks for the PR. let me try it out and get back.
Are you using this field as a partitionPath and recordKey? typically Hudi expects them to be non-null . That's probably why (although we could improve the error message for sure)

seems like the query cannot find a file. Without much insights into the state of the table, there could be few scenarios 
- too aggressive cleaning (you can check if the commit time `20190819205739` is recent or towards the earliest in `.hoodie` or using CLI)
- some process outside hudi, actually removing the file
What is the status on this - meaning - what is required so that it is fixed  ?   Maybe I'll have a crack at it.
commit time is recent, how to make cleaning less aggressive?

If its recent or the most recent, then it should not be cleaned at all with the default settings (retains data for upto 10 commits).  If you are just testing, can you switch to master and try reproducing this again? Also when this happens, have you ls-ed s3 and confirmed the file exists?

@tooptoop4 The symptoms you noted are not connecting well. i.e cannot understand why number of files or specific partitions be affected.. Is there anything else differnt about these partitions? 

And is it intermittent ? Have you turned on consistency guard since you are writing to s3? https://hudi.apache.org/configurations.html#withConsistencyCheckEnabled
HUDI-29 tracks this. lets follow up there. closing this issue here

@hustnn Also sometimes class def not found happens if there are duplicate jars i.e multiple hoodie bundles .. the class loading could be different between jvms? Nothing else rings a bell..

I think @bhasudha was unable to reproduce this?

Closing this. Please reopen a JIRA or another thread to pursue the partitioning config.. https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/2077029c2422048aab2268fe34914edbf706631ead7b3664b4cfa5f5@<dev.hudi.apache.org> shared a similar solution to this
@imperio-wxm wondering if you had a chance to check it out.

@zhangxinjian123 When you evolve your schema, it has to be avro backwards compatible. If you change schemas not following those rules, the parquet-avro reader cannot read existing data and will throw exceptions like ArrayIndexOutOfBounds.
@arw357 are you still seeing this issue ?
@thesuperzapper this is now up, with full demo automation.. FYI
Hi @vinothchandar - please add amit@atlan.com to the slack group
in what version of hudi was consistency guard added ?

@vinothchandar I checked only one hoodie jar is under `presto/plugin/hive-hadoop2/`.

Do you mean @bhasudha can run it normally on jvm 11?
